title: The EU's MiCA Framework
description: A micro-lesson that makes The EU's MiCA Framework usable.

hook.text: The EU passed the Markets in Crypto-Assets regulation in 2023 â€” the world's first comprehensive crypto legal framework.

buildup.text: MiCA requires crypto companies to register, disclose risks, hold reserves for stablecoins, and protect consumers.

discovery.text: For the first time, crypto companies had a clear rulebook. Compliance was possible because the rules actually existed.

twist.text: Some worry MiCA is too restrictive. DeFi protocols and NFTs were largely excluded because regulators couldn't classify them.

climax.text: Europe chose regulation over ambiguity. Whether it attracts or repels crypto innovation will be the test.

punchline.text: Europe wrote the rules. The rest of the world is watching to see if they work.

quiz.question: What makes MiCA significant in crypto regulation?
options: It's the world's first comprehensive legal framework for crypto assets
